boardgame.name: Steam and Steel
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:
"Steam and Steel
Aether-powered Kharadron sky-ships soar through the clouds, Corsair wolf-ships cut through the waves armed with monster-hunting harpoons, and helblaster volley guns erupt from the walls of the Free Cities. The cogs of war are ever-turning, and the Mortal Realms are in need of talented smiths.

Warhammer Age of Sigmar Steam and Steel presents everything you need to begin crafting your own weapons, armour, and machines of war. This book contains new aetheric equipment for the Kharadron, new Fyreslayer runes, new weapons and crafting rules, alchemy and potion making, and rules for vehicular combat along with dozens of example ships and war machines. Not only that, but Steam and Steel explores what crafting means to cultures across the Mortal Realms — for some it is simply a job, for others it reflects a lifelong devotion to their deity.

Steam and Steel is perfect for players looking to create their own equipment, and for GMs who are looking to bring ship-to-ship combat and large-scale vehicular destruction to their game!"

boardgame.name: Fossilis: Kickstarter Edition Expansions
boardgame.description:
All mini expansion included in Fossilis: Kickstarter Edition were sold by the publisher as one bundle.

Included Mini-/Micro-Expansions:

1 Bone Wars Solo Mode
Determined fossil hunters Othniel Marsh and Edward Cope shared a heated rivalry known as the “Bone Wars” in the late 19th century, to see who would dominate the world of dinosaur discovery. This is your chance to test yourself against one of these fierce competitors!

1 Power Tools Micro-Expansion

1 Caution Tape Micro-Expansion

1 Ice Age Mini-Expansion (includes 20 beautiful aqua "Ice Crystals"

1 Scorpion Mini-Expansion (includes 1 scorpion miniature)

2 Undiscovered Species Cards

boardgame.name: Shipwrecked!
boardgame.description:
Shipwrecked! is a semi-cooperative survival game for up to 4 players. Taking control of ‘Brains’ and ‘Brawn’, players will explore a mysterious island inhabited by pirates, dinosaurs and monsters.

By working together and combining their skills, Brains and Brawn can craft useful tools and weapons that will help them defeat the toughest enemies, and survive long enough to repair the ship and escape. But temptation and betrayal is never far away…

The goal is to escape before the unstable volcano erupts and destroys the island, but the ultimate winner is the one who makes it out alive with the most treasure. It’s survival of the fittest...and richest!

boardgame.name: 6: Siege – Year 1: Re-Enforce
boardgame.description:
6: Siege - The Board Game is an asymmetrical tabletop game with miniatures for 2 to 4 players, based on Ubisoft’s acclaimed tactical shooter video game, Tom Clancy’s Rainbow Six: Siege. Gameplay is fast and frenetic, allowing players to feel the tension of a cinematic assault with simulated real-time gameplay. Players control a team of 5 operators (all attackers or all defenders), with each Operator boasting different gadgets and abilities. Building your team of 5 is a very rewarding step of the game, offering endless possibilities and strategic choices. As the attacker, you will use your explosive arsenal to tear down walls and obstacles to reach your objective! As the defender, you will shape the battleground to your advantage and seek to thwart your opponent’s plans by denying them chances to attack.

Year 1 - Re-Enforce adds 8 operators to the base game. All of them being from the first year, or the first season, of the video game. They expand upon existing mechanisms and provide different options. And with the expanded roster, you’ll have more creative freedom while drafting your squad. Some Operators really benefit from synergies, while others are particularly suited for a specific environment

For the attackers, Blackbeard is a more resilient Operator while Buck and Hibana are wall-breachers above all. Last but not least, Capitão is all about creating – literal – chokepoints with his asphyxiating bolts!

On the defenders’ side, Frost and Caveira provide very powerful reactions the attacker doesn’t want to see triggered! On the other hand, Valkyrie and Echo are all about locating their targets: no one can escape their vigilant eye.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Pandoria: Trolls & Trails
boardgame.description:
Your scouts have discovered a hidden valley deep in the mountains of Pandoria, divided by rivers and large lakes. Here your people can develop the land undisturbed. But as you begin to inhabit these new lands, you discover that you are not alone: trolls from the surrounding mountains are staking their claims. You compete with the increasingly powerful trolls for the greatest influence in these 7 new territories.
Can you evolve fast enough to be the dominant realm in the end?

Trolls & Trails contains a new double-sided game board to play solo against the trolls, or to have an alternative map containing "trails" over the mountains.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Activity Casino
boardgame.description: The simple basic recipe of the classic game - guessing terms - is once again the top priority. Activity Casino does without a game board and game pieces. Instead, there is a starting capital in the form of chips that serve as bets, just like in a real casino. Each team gives a tip on how many searched terms the group of actors can correctly guess. If the players are correct, their bet is doubled, otherwise the chips are lost. The performing team is also rewarded depending on the number of tasks solved and the chips won can be used to increase the stake in the next round.

boardgame.name: Mati per Barkolana
boardgame.description: Mati per Barkolana is a deck of 32 cards depicting 17 funny crew members for your Barkolana team. "El petesson", "El sparagin", "El gambuser" and others will help you win the greatest sailing race of all the world.

boardgame.name: GreedFall Gold Edition
boardgame.description:
GreedFall Gold Edition, the definitive way to experience the beloved fantasy RPG adventure from Spiders Studio and Focus Home Interactive is out now, with up to 4K UHD, fast loadings and enhanced performance on Xbox Series X|S! The Gold Edition includes the base game and new expansion: The De Vespe Conspiracy. This expansion brings new enemies and gear with a twisting narrative that expands on GreedFall’s acclaimed story. Watch the new trailer and dive into GreedFall's most complete edition today!

The beloved RPG adventure gets a brand new expansion!
The De Vespe Conspiracy expands on GreedFall’s cherished world and story, inviting you to set foot on a previously undiscovered region of Teer Fradee and tackle a brand new intrigue. Navigate a web of lies, manipulation and secrets, as you unravel a nefarious conspiracy that threatens the balance of power. Explore an uncharted region of the island, battle strange new beasts and face off against a villainous new enemy faction in your hunt to uncover the truth.
boardgame.videogameversion: North American Xbox Series X edition

boardgame.name: Scrape
boardgame.description:
In West Africa, facial injury has been used to identify ethnic groups, families, individuals, and also to denote beauty; wounds were thought to beautify the body. It was also done in girls to mark the stages of life: puberty, marriage, etc. These scars helped women to make men more attractive because they appeal to looking as well as scars, as evidence that women can withstand labor pain. It is believed to bring people good luck and protection from evil.

In Scrape, the rules within the tribes will determine the rules of the game and the symbols will determine the meaning of the game. While playing, you will both have fun and experience the difficulties of the tribal life.

The player whose turn it is opens from the symbol card on the playing field and finds the symbol on the playing field according to the color of the card. Whoever finds it first gets the symbol.

The player who gets 12 symbols wins, starts the next game as the chieftain with 2 symbols.

All parts are prepared by hand.

boardgame.name: Amelia's Secret
El Secreto de Amelia
boardgame.description:
Amelia’s Secret is an Escape Game in augmented reality (AR) with a free companion App.

First, players have to place all game cards (AR markers) in their indicated locations: on a table, a wall, a piece of furniture. Using their smartphone or tablet, players scan each AR markers to display the room’s 3D objects. For example: a magical mirror or a sink full of blood. This game needs a free iOS/Android application to be played. (It’s simply called Amelia’s Secret.) Once you have placed the cards, all the game will be on the app.

It is an escape game, that means players must resolve enigmas, use the right object at the right time, in the minimum amount of time possible before the mansion closes forever!

There are 3 different levels:

The tutorial: it only uses the “tuto marker”. It introduces augmented reality, how to play the game and the way to resolve enigmas.

Level 1: this is the short round, and it uses every markers. It lasts about 20 minutes. The most important here is the overall mechanics, there are less riddles than in level 2 and the story stays backward.

Level 2: This is the full game. It lasts about 60 minutes. That is where you can understand Amelia’s Secret, if you overcome every riddles in time…

boardgame.name: Flames of War: Hungarian Steel – Mid-War Hungarian Forces 1942-43
boardgame.description:
The Hungarians joined the war against the Soviet Union in June 1941, first contributing a mobile corps of light tanks, motorised infantry and cavalry. By 1942 they had committed an entire field army of 220,000 men made up of ten divisions in three corps. The freshly raised force was made up of young Hungarian recruits with little combat experience, but they were soon proving themselves in hard fighting on the Don River. They were backed up by the 1st Armoured Field Division who had many veterans of the fighting in 1941.

You will find

Background on the 2nd Hungarian Army on the Eastern front 1942 to 1943.
Instructions on how to build:
A T-38 Tank Company
A Panzer IV Tank Company
An Autocannon Company
A Motorised Rifle Company
A Huszár Squadron formation of cavalry
A Rifle Company
A selection of support including Marder Tank-hunters, Csaba armoured cars, 75mm anti-tank guns, Assault Pioneers, anti-aircraft, artillery and air support.

Also includes a painting guide and handy basing guide to help get you troops on the table.
The booklet comes bundled with Unit Cards (36) and Command Cards (27).


–description from the publisher (extract)
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Flames of War: The World War II Miniatures Game

boardgame.name: Kardashev Scale
boardgame.description:
The Kardashev scale is a method of measuring a civilization’s level of technological advancement based on the amount of energy it is able to use.


A Type I civilization, also called a Planetary civilization — can use and store all of the energy available on its planet.



A Type II civilization, also called a Stellar civilization — can use and control energy at the scale of its planetary system.



A Type III civilization, also called a Galactic civilization — can use and control energy at the scale of its entire host galaxy.


Race your neighboring planets for control of the galaxy by achieving technological and cultural advancements that harness the energy of your people and your planet. Engage in conflict, trade, or research as a means to cultivate your civilization, capture the energy of your home star, and ultimately the energy of the entire galaxy! The most advanced civilization at the end of the game wins!

Each round, you'll choose one of four actions to perform at a Summit: collecting one of 3 types of resources or purchasing Advancements. In a rock-paper-scissors fashion, you will compare your chosen action to the actions chosen by your left and right neighbors. Win against one or both of them, and you'll collect 2 of your chosen resources. Tie and you'll gain 1. Lose, and you gain nothing. If you chose instead to Advance, you won't get any resources (and your neighbors will each gain 2 of their chosen resource), you will be able to purchase an Advancement card which will give you VPs and allow you to start building your engine. The game ends once one player reaches 25 or more VPs, and the player with the most points is the winner!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: IS: Intelligence Service
boardgame.description:
A new terrorist organisation has appeared and is threatening the world peace. You are at the head of one of the most powerful secret service agency. By using your spy satellites you will be able to locate your enemies. Send your best spies to annihilate their plans but be quick, other agencies are on it and they want all the credit for themselves !

How to play ?


Every turn you must move at least one of your three satellites on a different row.
The card your satellites is pointing will determine your actions.


The card on the operation field could either be an objectives, terrorists, pieces of equipment or other nation spy.

Objectives and enemy spies can only be defeated if your total attack points exceed their defenses.

Your attack is determined by your special powers, your equipement and by rolling dices.

- your turn ends when you have make use of your three satellites.

Once every player have played their turn, the operation field operate a rotation.

By capturing objectives, sentinels or even enemies spies, you win victory points.

Set up wisely your satellites to outplay your ennemies !

With special equipment and a unique power to each and every agency, a lot of combos can be done which will most certainly please the most advanced players.

The game end when players have captured the number of objectives they agreed on before hand.
The player with the most victory points win.

Thanks to it's unique spotting mechanism and earth rotation, every session of IS: intelligence Service is like any other!

—description from the publisher

Dungeons and Dragonchess meet in this four-hour Icewind Dale adventure. A simple request to help restore the honor of the Four Heavenly Schools of Dragonchess takes you across the frozen tundra, and into underground ice caverns beneath Easthaven. There, you discover some unwelcome monsters making their lair. Can you defeat them on and off the board?

This is an Adventure League legal module, optimized for five level 3 characters. It includes gridless battlemaps for use on the virtual tabletop of your choice.

Geek Out! is the game of mind-challenging fun that finds out once and for all which player is the reigning geek authority on your favorite geeky pop culture subjects!

In the game, you will draw cards asking you to list things which fall under a certain category. Before you begin, however, the other players may try to steal your points (and bragging rights!), by bidding to list even more than the card requires. The bidding continues until one player is ready to “out-geek” their friends and family.

Geek Out! Video Games will have you and your friends geeking out about your favorite video games!

boardgame.name: 100 Low Fantasy Merchants
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Merchants are a staple in fantasy RPGs but more than often they have no personality and are here only to sell or buy items to adventurers. Make them deeper, potential allies or enemies, or even intrigue starters with this supplement !

This product offers a list of 100 of these more or less sympathetic merchants for your enjoyment !

boardgame.name: Hexia
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).





Hexia is a real-time strategy and management game, where your task, as the King of the Realm you have been assigned, is to create and expand the territory, build new infrastructures and command and lead your people. You will face events that will present themselves to you as opportunities for improvement or as unexpected circumstances to overcome, and your choices will be fundamental to allow your kingdom to have the success it deserves and thus obtain a place in the world.The universe of Hexia is full of unexpected surprises and mysteries to be discovered. A deep and articulate story lurks behind every event, and every decision you make will have an impact on the continuation of the world’s plot, as well as the kingdom’s resources.

The game is constantly evolving, starting from the humility of a single tile, each game has the potential to create an empire that will stand the test of time!

Features


Hexia is an immediate and intuitive game: explore, increase your wealth and your population by creating a huge kingdom.
Each choice will have a real impact on the events that take place throughout the game. Helping nobles, imprisoning a witch or avoiding building better roads – your behavior will affect the outcome of the game.
Single player mode focused on managing your kingdom. Enjoy the events that will shape your new world.
The world of Hexia will offer you challenges; it will be up to you to decide to complete them or let them slowly erode your empire.
Each game will never be the same as the previous one.
Game in constant development. Even though we are a small team of two, we believe in the work we do and take it seriously.


Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Solitari
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

AFTER THE ADVENTURE IN THE STEAM TUNNELS TO RESCUE JACK ROGERS’ GOLDFISH*, things return to what passes for normal in town. However, a trip to the local Milk Bar and Diner presents the characters with a new mystery.

boardgame.name: School for Secrets
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

An elite boarding school in the countryside - home to an eclectic group of Teachers led by the sinister Headmaster, and presiding over a school where lessons include training for Thieves, Assassins, Secret Agents and Pariahs with mutant powers!

boardgame.name: Hawk Castle
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

HAWK CASTLE! Beautiful castle and keep on top of Hawk Peak, sheltered from the annihilating cold of its home-world by the miles-high Hands of Fate and its lofty elevation. Within the castle the Staff cater to the needs of visiting adventurers, but it is the Dungeon level where the real mystery lies...

boardgame.name: Frogger: The Board Game
boardgame.description:
Frogger - The Board Game is the officially licensed by Konami fun-filled reimagining of the classic video game for the whole family. Race your frog safely across the river to get to the tasty flies before your opponents. Watch out for vehicles and obstacles that can stop you in your tracks, and be sure to avoid the other hungry predators...they're just waiting to slip you up!

Frogger the Board Game brings you back to 1981, the year Frogger was introduced in arcades everywhere. Just like the original video game, move your frog across the roads and water. Dodge cars and crocs while trying to prevent other players from achieving the same goal. Catch the most flies to win the most points! The game is played over four rounds (two water and two road) to make two complete trips across the board. After the fourth round, the player who has the most points, wins

boardgame.name: Hillside Thickets
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Combining Lovecraftian horror, science fiction, cyberpunk, time travel, an isolated island setting, post-industrial horror, exploration and some puzzles, as well as vicious wilderness encounters and surfing with sharks, Hillside Thickets is a female focused modern day adventure setting campaign sourcebook.

boardgame.name: Eternal Voyage of Sinbad
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This WHITEFRANK sourcebook provides a welter of charts, monsters, shipwreck rules, detailed rules on Spices and Islands - Settled Islands, Exotic Islands where strange native peoples well, Legendary Islands such as Hy Breasil, Laputa, Lemuria, Mu, Atlantis and many more, Spice Islands and weird random islands of all kinds. Also rules for Faithful, Byzantine, Frank, Viking and other amazing characters. Greek Fire! Sea Monsters!

boardgame.name: Six-Gun Lullabye
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Wild West, the New Frontier... Where dungeon hacking means exploring Mine Tunnels and confronting the nightmare monsters of the Old West legendry!

boardgame.name: Hunger, Nausea, and the Adrenaline Rush
boardgame.description:
"In this document I present three new dynamics guaranteed to keep your game fresh. Hunger and nauaea are both conditions meant to add a layer of realism, and the adrenaline rush is built to increase survivability in high-risk situations."

(Author Summary)

boardgame.name: Goldfish Graveyard
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A short adventure featuring a map designed by the amazingly talented Nyhur, stunning illustrations, and a quest to rescue the goldfish Ming the Merciful from the steam tunnel sewer system! Will the characters succeed? Or will they fall prey to Toilet Hobos, Sewer King Skatepunks or the cultish Femme Fatale?

boardgame.name: World of Realm: BATTLE CIRCLE
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

WORLD OF REALM is a major campaign setting for WHITEFRANK. In World of Realm, characters come from a variety of other worlds, or are native born descendants of those outworlders, engaged in fantasy battles, quests, adventures and sometimes desperate struggles against existential threats to existence as it is understood.

BATTLE CIRCLE details the eponymous arena of personal combat. The Battle Circle is a location within Realm, where single combat, trios of fighters or quartets of fighters enter the circle – and only one must remain conscious or alive to win.

boardgame.name: Incorgnito
boardgame.description:
In this corgi themed game players use their Incorgnito cards wisely to gather information about a secret item, sniffing around for the correct answer. Go "Incorgnito" to be the best dogtective of the bunch!

Each secret item card contains an image of a corgi dressed up in costume. One player is the clue giver and the other players are tasked with guessing what item the clue giver has. The clue giver starts the round by saying "the secret item is a little bit like a corgi."

The play proceeds with the player on the left choosing an incorgnito card from their hand and placing it face up and asking if the secret item is more like the item pictured on the incorgnito card.

The clue giver will confirm or deny and give one reason why.
Play continues in this manner until a player chooses to "sniff" out the secret item, if correct they are awarded points, if they are wrong play continues until the item is guessed.

At the end of the game, when each player has been clue giver twice, the points are tallied and the player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: EXIT: Das Spiel – Schatten über Mittelerde
EXIT: het spel – In de Ban van de Ring: Schaduwen boven Midden-Aarde
Exit: The Game – The Lord of the Rings: Shadows over Middle-earth
boardgame.description:
Hurry up, hobbits, because a threat grows in the land of Mordor where the shadows loom. Frodo and his companions have set out to save Middle-earth, and the fate of the free world is now in their hands — and in the hands of the players because the companions need help!

In Exit: The Game – The Lord of the Rings – Shadows over Middle-earth, the mighty wizard Gandalf has sent the players on a crucial mission, so they must embark on an adventure and fulfill his assignments for otherwise all hope dies. Together players visit the locations from J.R.R. Tolkien's "The Lord of the Rings", solve tricky magic puzzles, and support the companions against Nazgul, orcs, and other dark figures.

Difficulty level: 2 of 5

boardgame.name: Adventure Games: Im Nebelreich
boardgame.description:
Explore places, combine items, and experience stories in Adventure Games, a series of co-operative games from German publisher KOSMOS. In each of these titles, players are presented with a mysterious story that they must unravel over the course of play. Working together, players explore common areas, talk to people, look for clues, and combine various items to reveal the secret of the story. Depending on what decisions the players make, the course of history changes and there is no going back!

Unlike the co-operative EXIT: The Game series, titles in this series focus on the telling and discovery of the story with no time pressure. That said, many different paths can be experienced during play, with more than one correct resolution to the story waiting to be discovered. Each title consists of three chapters, each taking about 75 minutes to play. Nothing is destroyed, so the games can be played multiple times.

In Adventure Games: Im Nebelreich, you represent heroes who have returned from a short trip on behalf of an old seer to find their village deserted. Where did everyone go? Over three chapters, each of which takes about two hours to play, you will meet mysterious people, discover new places, and experience an exciting adventure. During your investigations, you also learn more about the individual heroes of this co-operative parlor game. How will the fantastic story end? That's up to you!

boardgame.name: The Lord of the Rings: Battle for Middle-Earth
boardgame.description:
In this fun and easy card game you will fight along side your favorite heroes from JRR Tolkien's high fantasy classic, The Lord of the Rings, against the powerful forces of Sauron in The Battle for Middle-earth. To defeat your enemies, you must create your own Fellowships of Companion Cards and send them into battle.

Despite having numerous Companions to aid your attack, the Eye of Sauron is always vigilant and you must beware of a Counterattack by the Enemies of Mordor.

The player who defeats the most dangerous Enemies, and collects the greatest number of victory points, wins the game.

boardgame.name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: German – Tiger I
boardgame.description:
Seen the movie Fury? Then you don’t need to know anything else about this iconic World War II tank. If not then trust us, it is good.

The Tiger I has solid stats with firepower 5 and initiative 4, but where it shines is the combination of Fortress (no penalty for being shot in the flank), survivability 2, and Heavy Tank (allowing you to re-roll a blank defense dice). Park this tank in front of your enemies and watch them sweat as shot after shot bounces.

Looking to lurk back in cover and pick your targets rather than tanking up frot? Add the gunner Erwin Prentzel to gain extra initiative in the shooting phase and extra defense whilst in cover.

boardgame.name: Asedio a Al-Ándalus (1150-1213)
boardgame.description:
“Time is like a sword; if you don't cut it, it cuts you"
(Arabic proverb)

Asedio a Al-Andalus (1150-1213) is a medieval strategy, geopolitics and diplomacy boardgame for 3 players that tries to represent the political, ideological and military conflicts that took place in the Iberian Peninsula and its areas of influence between the second half of the 12th century and the early 13th century, in an exciting time of crusades, epic battles and court intrigues.

In the game, each player will take on the role of one of those three main powers (Christian Kingdoms, Sharq Al-Andalus and the Almohad Caliphate) that were vying for power, hegemony and survival in the Iberian Peninsula during those turbulent years. Whether through military force, political cunning, seductive diplomacy, commercial wealth or cultural splendor, the player's goal will be to accumulate the highest number of victory points to become the peninsular power with more fame and glory.

The game uses a card drive system that consists of 7 turns and each of them represents a period of 9 years, beginning in the year 1150 and ending in the year 1213. In turn, each turn is divided into 5 different phases (opening, diplomacy, spring, action and winter). The game is completely asymmetrical, as each power has its own geographic position, resources, rulers, courtiers, military leaders, allied factions, and totally unique and specific thematic minigames.

The game ends if one of the following conditions is met: that a player reaches 50 victory points, that the end of turn 7 is reached (the player with the most victory points wins) or that the Sharq Al-Andalus is annexed (in which case the Christian player or the Almohad player will win, depending on their victory points).

boardgame.name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: Soviet – IS-2
boardgame.description: The IS-2 may be the Soviet answer to the Tiger 1. It too benefits from Fortress and Heavy Tank, but also brings a firepower 6 Big Gun that allows you to modify a hit to a critical, to the party. Add a Spall Liner to modify enemy critical hits back down to normal hits if you want to increase the IS-2’s chances of out lasting its enemies.

boardgame.name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: British – Comet
boardgame.description: The Comet looks a little like the trusty Cromwell but on steroids. It is one of those tanks that you could run naked without any addition crew or equipment if you wanted, trusting it’s great mobility, above average firepower and mobility and finally, outstanding survivability (for a Medium tank). Of course there is also a school of thought that suggests doubling down on your best tank with a few upgrades will help you squeeze a little more out of it. Adding a driver with Preventative Maintenance will reduce the number of incoming critical hits, whilst a commander with Jack Of All Trades will give you that initiative boost when you need it so help you move of shoot at the right time.

boardgame.name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: American – M26 Pershing
boardgame.description: The M26 Pershing is remembered for being a Panther killer and as a Medium Tank it is all about offence, re-rolling a blank attack dice. Combine that with firepower 6 and the M26 doesn’t really need much in the way of upgrades. What are we saying, it was built for Smooth Ride (which allows you to reduce the penalty of moving when firing) and aggressive players that want to get the most out of this tank should look no further than commander Edward Crane who will grant you additional initiative in the movement phase for every two crew on the tank with his Mentor skill AND if you are feeling confident, gives you the opportunity to roll one less attack dice to modify a hit to a critical thanks to Eagle Eye.

boardgame.name: EXIT: Das Spiel – Die Rückkehr in die verlassene Hütte
Exit: The Game – The Return to the Abandoned Cabin
boardgame.description:
EXIT The Game: The Return to the Abandoned Cabin is a sequel to Exit: The Game – The Abandoned Cabin with lots of new puzzles and tools.

One ordinary morning, a police detective rings your doorbell. He asks you to come with him — to a cabin in the woods. You instantly know it’s the same cabin in which the sinister riddle master Dr. Arthur Funbeq locked you up a few years ago. Apparently, he has just escaped from prison. Now you’re headed back to the infamous cabin where it all began to help bring Funbeq down. The adventure begins … again!

A celebration of 5 years since the initial Exit game, The Abandoned Cabin!

Difficulty Level 3 / 5

EXIT: The Game is a series of escape room games for the home. Players must solve riddles and puzzles and crack codes to escape from an imaginary room or environment. … One-time use: Each game can only be played once, because you must mark up, fold, and tear the game materials to crack the codes.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: AdverCity
boardgame.description:
PREPARE FOR AN ALL-OUT DOWNTOWN DEVASTATION!

In AdverCity, your duty is to lead your town to brighter days. The terrain your town is built on is often plagued with horrific and deadly disasters. As the newly elected mayor, you must push past the obstacles that lie before you and prepare your town for the impending doom. No one has succeeded thus far, but we believe in your ability to lead!

You must increase your cities' population, ensure that your citizens are well fed, and provide them with financial security. Will you overcome the challenges that lie ahead of you as mayor of this unfortunate town? Can you prepare your town and survive the imminent disasters that come your way?

AdverCity can be played with either 3 or 4 people. A 3 player game consists of 18 turns and a 4 player game consists of 14 turns. On each turn, a player rolls the dice to determine the resources everyone gets from their buildings on that turn. Once the resources are distributed to everyone, the player can buy more buildings, trade with others, and feed their population. Disaster rounds occur throughout the game dependent of the number of players. In order to win, a player must end the game with the highest population by protecting their citizens from various disasters. So, go out and save your town!

boardgame.name: Speedy Doc
boardgame.description:
Speedy Doc knows everything about everything! Will you be able to outsmart him?

In this fast-paced electronic game Speedy Doc proposes a topic. Each player has to find something that matches the topic.

But be careful! Speedy Doc is unpredictable and likes to change the rules at any time. A piece of advice: stay focused and answer him quickly! If not, you will get a ZERO.

At the end of the game, the player with the least zeros wins. Laughter guaranteed – no two rounds are alike! Included are more than 500 topics to play with family.

Screen reader support enabled.

boardgame.name: Splitz
스플리츠
boardgame.description:
Bid against other players to collect cards from the shared center row in this clever twist on trick-taking card games! Use strategies to split the row and your cunning to win the bid! Win the most of a number to score those points! Lower Numbers score lower points! Higher Numbers earn more points but are tougher to earn!

Splitz is played in a series of rounds. In each round the dealer turns Number Cards face up splits the row in three parts. Each player then secretly chooses one of the parts.

A player gets to keep the group of cards of no other player chooses it. If more than one player chooses a group of cards the dealer splits the group again and the secret selection process begins again.

Players try to collect as many cards of the same number as they can. The game continues until all number cards have been played.

The player who holds the majority of cards with the same number scores those points. The player with the highest point total wins.

listing.notes: Title: Splitz Publisher: Ultra Pro Entertainment Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Wyrmtooth Gully Ambush
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Two crushed wagons block the dirt road, the horses that once pulled them dead and covered in blood. The contents of barrels and crates have been scattered wildly.
Wagon wheel ruts cut through the road as it winds its way through this gully. Jagged rocky outcrops tower over those below, grown over with bushes, wildflowers and sparse trees.

boardgame.name: Deadwind Canyon Ambush
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Two crushed wagons block the dusty road, the horses that once pulled them dead and covered in blood. The contents of barrels and crates have been scattered wildly.
Wagon wheel ruts cut through the dirt, following the path as it winds its way through this desert canyon. Jagged rocky outcrops tower over those below, covered with shale and dry bushes.
You can hear the buzzing of flies, and cries from vultures circling overhead.

boardgame.name: Frozen Maw Pass Ambush
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Two crushed wagons block the frozen road, the horses that once pulled them dead and covered in blood. The contents of barrels and crates have been scattered wildly.
Wagon wheel ruts cut through the snow, following the road as it winds its way through this frozen pass. Jagged rocky outcrops tower over those below, grown over with snow-laden bushes and sparse trees.

Adventure Seed

Hired as guards for a merchant caravan, you travel through an icy pass in the mountains only to find your way is blocked by the remnants of an earlier caravan. The two horses lie dead in the snow and are being torn apart by two different monsters.
You hear yelling from a nearby tree on one of the rocky bluffs, and see a man clinging to the high branches. Another, different monster is prowling around its base, trying in vain to get to him. He shouts at you not to kill the monsters, explaining that they’re his family and they were only polymorphed into the creatures by a tainted potion. They don’t remember who they are, but the effects will wear off in a couple of hours.
Until then, he begs you to restrain them, not kill them.
WHAT’S HAPPENING? The man, his wife and children were transporting their alchemical wares to sell at seasonal markets. But the carts went over a large log that had been buried by snow, which jostled the volatile crates and caused an explosion.
Some tainted polymorph potions splashed onto the others, but the man was already crouching looking for a snack in his rucksack when the blast went off which is how he avoided the substance.
If you try to get past the monsters or move the wreckage off the road, they’ll attack. If the monsters are killed, they turn back into a woman and two young boys—twins, about ten years old. The man will weep over their bodies, then try to stab you with a dagger while yelling at you and crying.

boardgame.name: CATAN: Zusatzmaterial für Das Duell – Bonus Box
boardgame.description:
CATAN: Zusatzmaterial für Das Duell – Bonus Box includes material to expand CATAN: Das Duell, both in terms of gameplay and functionality.

This expansion includes 15 special cards that offer additional strategic possibilities, a dice tower, a point tracker so that you don't have to count icons repeatedly, auxiliary markers, and a tournament mode.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Versions & Editions: Two-Player Versions of More-Player Games

boardgame.name: Frostbane's Ruined Temple Outpost
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Snow coats the main thoroughfare of this outpost, though it has been churned by the wheels of wagons and many feet into a muddy slush. What once was a crumbling temple has become a stronghold. The main room of worship has been turned into a mess hall, with tables laden with drinks, weapons, maps, paperwork, books and food waiting before a statue of a robed figure holding an empty bowl.
Some rooms still contain stone benches covered with urns of the dead, while others have been cleared to fit desks or beds. Yet more have become cells, while a couple of caves have been turned into storage for food and weapons, or been strung up with hammocks over coarse hay.
The wind whistles forlornly through this place, bringing with it cold flakes of snow, or heavy sleet.

boardgame.name: Overgrown Jungle Temple
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This ruined desert temple is carved into the sides of a ravine, with fast clear water flowing below. Tall palms line the sides of the cliffs, while other leafy plants creep along the ground, growing on the rubble amidst wildflowers.
Some rooms are filled with pools of water, whilst others only contain intricate tiles, long since covered with sand and rubble. A central chamber contains a raised platform with a chest, overgrown with flowers.
Rickety wooden bridges connect the walkways in places where the original stone has fallen away. Some lead to large rooms, while others are only small and filled with stone benches of urns. Birds cry loudly as they fly between nests in the cliffs.

boardgame.name: Tomb of the Seekers
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Running through the centre of this crumbling tomb is a steep stone ravine, filled with mist that disguise the steep descent down into darkness.
Some rooms are filled with pools of water, whilst others only contain cracked tombs and intricate tiles, long since covered with rubble. A central chamber contains a sarcophagus with the carving of a sleeping king on top. Behind him waits a large chest on a raised platform, surrounded by more rubble.
Rickety wooden bridges connect the walkways in places where the original stone has fallen away. Some lead to large rooms, while others are only small and filled with stone benches of urns.

boardgame.name: Ruined Coral Temple
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Fish dart throughout the ruins of this underwater temple. Light filters down through the waves to dance on intricately tiled floors, partially covered in rubble from where the walls are eroding away.
Red, blue and orange corals grow alongside the cliffs from a ravine that divides the temple in two. Beyond the corals waits only darkness, and inky blue depths…

boardgame.name: Froggo Roll & Write
boardgame.description:
Froggo is a nice Roll & Write style printable board game, during the game we must assume the role of Froggo and paint as many squares before the game turns are over, for which for each jump we will paint a square, at the same Time the enemies will paint the squares so that we add less points at the end of the game.

There are different levels of difficulty (game sheets) that will give you variety, a simple and fast game that can be played in different modes.

During the turn of a player rolls the dice of Froggo and the dice of enemies, depending on the results Froggo will jump and paint the squares through which he jumps, the enemies will do the same.

The game ends when the last when the last frog in the turn zone is marked. A player wins if he scores higher than the enemies.

boardgame.name: Kutyatár kártyajáték
boardgame.description: DOG COMPETITION - The bigger puppy takes the smaller ones! But watch out, Lili takes every dog. Who will have the most dogs? DOG MEMO - Find each dog's mate. Whoever has the best memory will have the most cute puppies. WHO HAS LILI? - In whose hands is Lili left? Put the pairs down and draw each other with a poker face! Who will Lili stay with? DOG KENNEL - Lili adopted a puppy. Just answer yes and no to your partner to help you figure out which doggie it is! Game rules in the box!

boardgame.name: Forgotten Tomb of the Rakshik
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This ruined desert temple is carved into the sides of a ravine, with fast clear water flowing below. Tall palms line the sides of the cliffs, while other leafy plants creep along the ground, growing on the rubble amidst wildflowers.
Some rooms are filled with pools of water, whilst others only contain cracked tombs and intricate tiles, long since covered with sand. A central chamber contains a sarcophagus with the carving of a sleeping king on top. Behind him waits a large chest on a raised platform, overgrown with flowers.
Rickety wooden bridges connect the walkways in places where the original stone has fallen away. Some lead to large rooms, while others are only small and filled with stone benches of urns. Birds cry loudly as they fly between nests in the cliffs.

boardgame.name: Morid's Pass Ruined Temple Outpost
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

What once was a crumbling temple has become a desert stronghold. The main room of worship has been turned into a mess hall, with tables laden with drinks, weapons, maps, paperwork, books and food waiting before a statue of a robed figure holding an empty bowl.
Intricate stone tiles are covered with rubble from the crumbling walls, or sand that has blown in from the road. A dry wind wails through the road in the center of the outpost, the dirt engraved with the ruts of wagon wheels. It is lined with wildflowers, and leafy, creeping plants which have partially overgrown the rest of the temple, too.
Some rooms still contain stone benches covered with urns of the dead, while others have been cleared to fit desks or beds. Yet more have become cells, while a couple of caves have been turned into storage for food and weapons, or been strung up with hammocks over coarse hay. Blue water pools within a couple of them.
Frogs call out from amidst the undergrowth, alongside crickets and, occasionally, cicadas.
